thread.title: Take an early look at Pike Place Market’s $74M expansion
thread.title_full: Take an early look at Pike Place Market’s $74M expansion - seattlepi.com

author: LEVI PULKKINEN, SEATTLEPI.COM STAFF
title: Take an early look at Pike Place Market’s $74M expansion
text:
Seattle’s downtown waterfront is ready for a revival, and Pike Place Market is about to try to steal the first scene.
The once-doomed, now-vibrant market will open a $74 million expansion in June. The MarketFront expansion will better connect the existing market with another major downtown tourist destination, the waterfront.
Related Stories SantaCon revelers 'take over' streets of Seattle Pike Place Market ranked among great American ‘food halls’ Hey, tourists! Downtown Seattle finally has legal weed Demolition of the Alaskan Way Viaduct – and completion of the tunnel that will replace it – is still at least four years away. Still, an expanded Pike Place promises a new public plaza, additional stall space for farmers and crafters and a neighborhood meeting place, among other amenities.
Check out the gallery above for a look at some early sketches of the coming expansion, as well as a look back at life at market.
Here’s how the market looked on a recent pass through:
Pike Place Market, Feb. 2017 Afternoon Time Lapse
Media: Seattle Post-Intelligencer A grand opening for the expansion is scheduled for June 29. The market’s foundation is still soliciting donations .
Seattlepi.com reporter Levi Pulkkinen can be reached at 206-448-8348 or levipulkkinen@seattlepi.com . Follow Levi on Twitter at twitter.com/levipulk .
